intro: Stipa peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian needlegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial species native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, while the flowers are typically pale green to golden in color. Stipa peruviana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
